titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rotary Club of Brooklyn publications ARC.143
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T10:06-0500

physdesc.extent: in two and a half manuscript boxes.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Rotary Club of Brooklyn (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Rotary Club of Brooklyn publications, ARC.143, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for the collection are unknown.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Rotary Club of Brooklyn was founded in 1914 as a local arm of Rotary International. The club's various committees, such as cultural, welfare, community safety, and community service, contributed to the organization's overall goal of improving the surrounding community through service and providing a productive social group for local businessmen and professionals. After a drop in membership in the 1970s, the Brooklyn club rebuilt itself in the late 1990s and continues serving the residents of the borough as of 2010.

list.head: Sources
list.item: Rotary International. "History of Rotary International." Accessed December 15, 2010. http://www.rotary.org/en/AboutUs/History/RIHistory/Pages/ridefault.aspx

Shelby, Joyce. "A Revitalized Rotary Gets Wheels Turning." New York Daily News, January 5, 1998. Accessed December 15, 2010. http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/ny_local/1998/01/05/1998-01-05_a_revitalized_rotary_gets_wh.html

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Rotary Club of Brooklyn publications span the years 1919 to 1977 and measure 1.04 linear feet. The publications detail activities of the club, members, officers, and the club's financial data. Items in the collection include the club's newsletter, The Rotary Felloe, treasurer's reports and budgets, officer and committee lists, annual yearbooks, and member rosters. The collection also contains a directory for all Long Island Rotary Clubs, listing the officers and contact information of each district club, and Spotlight On District 725, a monthly newsletter for all Rotary Clubs on Long Island.
